The school development processes in this volume extend and contribute lessons and examples beyond the mainstream turnaround literature from the U.S

Findings and lessons from the featured school development efforts in Germany, Australia, Sweden and the U.S. may support the development of a new international dialogue with a common, coherent, and intercultural language around how leadership capacity for education and school development can be supported and sustained within and between all levels that must be open to new uncertainties
